com.veriplace.client
Class ClientConfiguration

java.lang.Object
  com.veriplace.client.ClientConfiguration

public class ClientConfiguration
extends java.lang.Object

Encapsulates the various properties that can be configured for a Veriplace Client.

Since:
2.1

          The default setting for using HTTPS for machine-to-machine APIs: true

getServerUri

public java.lang.String getServerUri()
See setServerUri(String).

setServerUri

public void setServerUri(java.lang.String serverUri)
Specifies the base URL of the Veriplace server. If not specified, this defaults to DEFAULT_SERVER_URI.

getSecure

public java.lang.Boolean getSecure()
See setSecure(Boolean).

setSecure

public void setSecure(java.lang.Boolean secure)
Specifies whether to use HTTPs for all direct communications with the Veriplace server (that is, all requests other than user authorization redirects). If not specified, this defaults to DEFAULT_SECURE.

setApplicationToken

public void setApplicationToken(Token applicationToken)
Specifies the application-specific access token issued for this application. This token is only required for some interfaces.

public void setDefaultLocationMode(java.lang.String defaultLocationMode)

getLocationFilter

public LocationFilter getLocationFilter()
See setLocationFilter(LocationFilter).

setLocationFilter

public void setLocationFilter(LocationFilter locationFilter)
Specifies an object that can apply post-processing to returned locations. See LocationFilter.

getTokenStore

public TokenStore getTokenStore()
See setTokenStore(TokenStore).

setTokenStore

public void setTokenStore(TokenStore tokenStore)
Specifies an object that can store request tokens between operations. The default is an instance of FileTokenStore.
